metadata.title: CVE-2015-1225 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via unspecifiedvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076').
